member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.AssociateChannelFlowRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssociateChannelFlow operation. Associates a channel flow with a channel. Once associated, all messages to that channel go through channel flow processors. To stop processing, use the DisassociateChannelFlow API.
Only administrators or channel moderators can associate a channel flow. The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

The ARN of the channel flow.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The membership type of a user, DEFAULT or HIDDEN. Default members are always returned as part of ListChannelMemberships. Hidden members are only returned if the type filter in ListChannelMemberships equals HIDDEN. Otherwise hidden members are not returned. This is only supported by moderators.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ChannelFlowCallbackRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ChannelFlowCallback operation. Calls back Chime SDK Messaging with a processing response message. This should be invoked from the processor Lambda. This is a developer API.
You can return one of the following processing responses:
Update message content or metadata
Deny a message
Make no changes to the message

member.summary:

The identifier passed to the processor by the service when invoked. Use the identifier to call back the service.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelBanRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateChannelBan operation. Permanently bans a member from a channel. Moderators can't add banned members to a channel. To undo a ban, you first have to DeleteChannelBan, and then CreateChannelMembership. Bans are cleaned up when you delete users or channels.
If you ban a user who is already part of a channel, that user is automatically kicked from the channel.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelArn.
The ARN of the ban request.

The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

member.summary:

The ARN of the member being banned.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelArn.
The ARN of the response to the ban request.

member.summary:

The ChannelArn and BannedIdentity of the member in the ban response.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelFlowRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateChannelFlow operation. Creates a channel flow, a container for processors. Processors are AWS Lambda functions that perform actions on chat messages, such as stripping out profanity. You can associate channel flows with channels, and the processors in the channel flow then take action on all messages sent to that channel. This is a developer API.
Channel flows process the following items:
New and updated messages
Persistent and non-persistent messages
The Standard message type
Channel flows don't process Control or System messages. For more information about the message types provided by Chime SDK Messaging, refer to Message types in the Amazon Chime developer guide.

The client token for the request. An Idempotency token.

member.summary:

The name of the channel flow.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelMembershipRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateChannelMembership operation. Adds a user to a channel. The InvitedBy response field is derived from the request header. A channel member can:
List messages
Send messages
Receive messages
Edit their own messages
Leave the channel
Privacy settings impact this action as follows:
Public Channels: You do not need to be a member to list messages, but you must be a member to send messages.
Private Channels: You must be a member to list or send messages.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelMembershipRequest.ChannelArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelArn.
The ARN of the channel to which you're adding users.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelMembershipRequest.ChimeBearer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChimeBearer.
The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelMembershipRequest.MemberArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MemberArn.
The ARN of the member you want to add to the channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelMembershipRequest.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The membership type of a user, DEFAULT or HIDDEN. Default members are always returned as part of ListChannelMemberships. Hidden members are only returned if the type filter in ListChannelMemberships equals HIDDEN. Otherwise hidden members are not returned. This is only supported by moderators.

The ARN of the channel.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Member.
The ARN and metadata of the member being added.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelModeratorRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateChannelModerator operation. Creates a new ChannelModerator. A channel moderator can:
Add and remove other members of the channel.
Add and remove other moderators of the channel.
Add and remove user bans for the channel.
Redact messages in the channel.
List messages in the channel.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Mode.
The channel mode: UNRESTRICTED or RESTRICTED. Administrators, moderators, and channel members can add themselves and other members to unrestricted channels. Only administrators and moderators can add members to restricted channels.

The channel's privacy level: PUBLIC or PRIVATE. Private channels aren't discoverable by users outside the channel. Public channels are discoverable by anyone in the AppInstance.

member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteChannelFlow operation. Deletes a channel flow, an irreversible process. This is a developer API.
This API works only when the channel flow is not associated with any channel. To get a list of all channels that a channel flow is associated with, use the ListChannelsAssociatedWithChannelFlow API. Use the DisassociateChannelFlow API to disassociate a channel flow from all channels.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.GetChannelMessageStatusRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetChannelMessageStatus operation. Gets message status for a specified messageId. Use this API to determine the intermediate status of messages going through channel flow processing. The API provides an alternative to retrieving message status if the event was not received because a client wasn't connected to a websocket.
Messages can have any one of these statuses.
SENT
Message processed successfully
PENDING
Ongoing processing
FAILED
Processing failed
DENIED
Messasge denied by the processor
This API does not return statuses for denied messages, because we don't store them once the processor denies them.
Only the message sender can invoke this API.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.LambdaConfiguration
member.summary: Stores metadata about a Lambda processor.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.LambdaConfiguration.InvocationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvocationType.
Controls how the Lambda function is invoked.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.LambdaConfiguration.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The ARN of the Lambda message processing function.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelBansRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListChannelBans operation. Lists all the users banned from a particular channel.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelBansRequest.ChannelArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelArn.
The ARN of the channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelBansRequest.ChimeBearer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChimeBearer.
The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelBansRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of bans that you want returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelBansRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested bans are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelBansResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListChannelBans operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelBansResponse.ChannelArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelArn.
The ARN of the channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelBansResponse.ChannelBans
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelBans.
The information for each requested ban.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelBansResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested bans are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelFlowsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListChannelFlows operation. Returns a paginated lists of all the channel flows created under a single Chime. This is a developer API.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelFlowsRequest.AppInstanceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AppInstanceArn.
The ARN of the app instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelFlowsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of channel flows that you want to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelFlowsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested channel flows are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelFlowsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListChannelFlows operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelFlowsResponse.ChannelFlows
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelFlows.
The information about each channel flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelFlowsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested channels are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUserRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUser operation. Lists all channels that a particular AppInstanceUser is a part of. Only an AppInstanceAdmin can call the API with a user ARN that is not their own.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUserRequest.AppInstanceUserArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AppInstanceUserArn.
The ARN of the AppInstanceUsers

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUserRequest.ChimeBearer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChimeBearer.
The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUserRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of users that you want returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUserRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token returned from previous API requests until the number of channel memberships is reached.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUserResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUser operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUserResponse.ChannelMemberships
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelMemberships.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested users are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsForAppInstanceUserResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested users are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListChannelMemberships operation. Lists all channel memberships in a channel.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsRequest.ChannelArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelArn.
The maximum number of channel memberships that you want returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsRequest.ChimeBearer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChimeBearer.
The AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of channel memberships that you want returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested channel memberships are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMembershipsRequest.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The membership type of a user, DEFAULT or HIDDEN. Default members are always returned as part of ListChannelMemberships. Hidden members are only returned if the type filter in ListChannelMemberships equals HIDDEN. Otherwise hidden members are not returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMessagesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListChannelMessages operation. List all the messages in a channel. Returns a paginated list of ChannelMessages. By default, sorted by creation timestamp in descending order.
Redacted messages appear in the results as empty, since they are only redacted, not deleted. Deleted messages do not appear in the results. This action always returns the latest version of an edited message.
Also, the x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMessagesRequest.ChannelArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChannelArn.
The ARN of the channel.

member.summary:

member.summary:

The maximum number of messages that you want returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMessagesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested messages are returned.

member.summary:

member.summary:

The order in which you want messages sorted. Default is Descending, based on time created.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.Processor
member.summary: The information about a processor in a channel flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.Processor.Configuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Configuration.
The information about the type of processor and its identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.Processor.ExecutionOrder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionOrder.
The sequence in which processors run. If you have multiple processors in a channel flow, message processing goes through each processor in the sequence. The value determines the sequence. At this point, we support only 1 processor within a flow.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.Processor.FallbackAction
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FallbackAction.
Determines whether to continue or stop processing if communication with processor fails. If the last processor in a channel flow sequence has a fallback action of CONTINUE, and communication with the processor fails, the message is considered processed and sent to the recipients in the channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.Processor.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the channel flow.

Gets and sets the property Lambda.
Indicates that the processor is of type Lambda.

Container for the parameters to the RedactChannelMessage operation. Redacts message content, but not metadata. The message exists in the back end, but the action returns null content, and the state shows as redacted.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.SendChannelMessageRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the SendChannelMessage operation. Sends a message to a particular channel that the member is a part of.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.
Also, STANDARD messages can contain 4KB of data and the 1KB of metadata. CONTROL messages can contain 30 bytes of data and no metadata.

member.name: T:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.AmazonChimeSDKMessagingClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing ChimeSDKMessaging
The Amazon Chime SDK Messaging APIs in this section allow software developers to send and receive messages in custom messaging applications. These APIs depend on the frameworks provided by the Amazon Chime SDK Identity APIs. For more information about the messaging APIs, see Amazon Chime SDK messaging

member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.AmazonChimeSDKMessagingClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonChimeSDKMessagingClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.AmazonChimeSDKMessagingClient.AssociateChannelFlow(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.AssociateChannelFlowRequest)
member.summary:
Associates a channel flow with a channel. Once associated, all messages to that channel go through channel flow processors. To stop processing, use the DisassociateChannelFlow API.
Only administrators or channel moderators can associate a channel flow. The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AssociateChannelFlow service method.
member.returns: The response from the AssociateChannelFlow service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.

The service is currently unavailable.

member.summary:
Calls back Chime SDK Messaging with a processing response message. This should be invoked from the processor Lambda. This is a developer API.
You can return one of the following processing responses:
Update message content or metadata
Deny a message
Make no changes to the message

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.AmazonChimeSDKMessagingClient.CreateChannelBan(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelBanRequest)
member.summary:
Permanently bans a member from a channel. Moderators can't add banned members to a channel. To undo a ban, you first have to DeleteChannelBan, and then CreateChannelMembership. Bans are cleaned up when you delete users or channels.
If you ban a user who is already part of a channel, that user is automatically kicked from the channel.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateChannelBan service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateChannelBan service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.AmazonChimeSDKMessagingClient.CreateChannelFlow(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelFlowRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a channel flow, a container for processors. Processors are AWS Lambda functions that perform actions on chat messages, such as stripping out profanity. You can associate channel flows with channels, and the processors in the channel flow then take action on all messages sent to that channel. This is a developer API.
Channel flows process the following items:
New and updated messages
Persistent and non-persistent messages
The Standard message type
Channel flows don't process Control or System messages. For more information about the message types provided by Chime SDK Messaging, refer to Message types in the Amazon Chime developer guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateChannelFlow service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateChannelFlow service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.

The client is permanently forbidden from making the request.

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.AmazonChimeSDKMessagingClient.CreateChannelMembership(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelMembershipRequest)
member.summary:
Adds a user to a channel. The InvitedBy response field is derived from the request header. A channel member can:
List messages
Send messages
Receive messages
Edit their own messages
Leave the channel
Privacy settings impact this action as follows:
Public Channels: You do not need to be a member to list messages, but you must be a member to send messages.
Private Channels: You must be a member to list or send messages.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateChannelMembership service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateChannelMembership service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.
member.exception: The input parameters don't match the service's restrictions.

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.AmazonChimeSDKMessagingClient.GetChannelMessageStatus(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.GetChannelMessageStatusRequest)
member.summary:
Gets message status for a specified messageId. Use this API to determine the intermediate status of messages going through channel flow processing. The API provides an alternative to retrieving message status if the event was not received because a client wasn't connected to a websocket.
Messages can have any one of these statuses.
SENT
Message processed successfully
PENDING
Ongoing processing
FAILED
Processing failed
DENIED
Messasge denied by the processor
This API does not return statuses for denied messages, because we don't store them once the processor denies them.
Only the message sender can invoke this API.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetChannelMessageStatus service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetChannelMessageStatus service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.
member.exception: The input parameters don't match the service's restrictions.

The service is currently unavailable.

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.AmazonChimeSDKMessagingClient.ListChannelMessages(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMessagesRequest)
member.summary:
List all the messages in a channel. Returns a paginated list of ChannelMessages. By default, sorted by creation timestamp in descending order.
Redacted messages appear in the results as empty, since they are only redacted, not deleted. Deleted messages do not appear in the results. This action always returns the latest version of an edited message.
Also, the x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.summary:
Interface for accessing ChimeSDKMessaging
The Amazon Chime SDK Messaging APIs in this section allow software developers to send and receive messages in custom messaging applications. member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.IAmazonChimeSDKMessaging.AssociateChannelFlow(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.AssociateChannelFlowRequest)
member.summary:
Associates a channel flow with a channel. Once associated, all messages to that channel go through channel flow processors. To stop processing, use the DisassociateChannelFlow API.
Only administrators or channel moderators can associate a channel flow. The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.IAmazonChimeSDKMessaging.CreateChannelBan(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelBanRequest)
member.summary:
Permanently bans a member from a channel. Moderators can't add banned members to a channel. To undo a ban, you first have to DeleteChannelBan, and then CreateChannelMembership. Bans are cleaned up when you delete users or channels.
If you ban a user who is already part of a channel, that user is automatically kicked from the channel.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateChannelBan service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateChannelBan service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.IAmazonChimeSDKMessaging.CreateChannelFlow(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelFlowRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a channel flow, a container for processors. Processors are AWS Lambda functions that perform actions on chat messages, such as stripping out profanity. You can associate channel flows with channels, and the processors in the channel flow then take action on all messages sent to that channel. This is a developer API.
Channel flows process the following items:
New and updated messages
Persistent and non-persistent messages
The Standard message type
Channel flows don't process Control or System messages. For more information about the message types provided by Chime SDK Messaging, refer to Message types in the Amazon Chime developer guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateChannelFlow service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateChannelFlow service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.IAmazonChimeSDKMessaging.CreateChannelMembership(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.CreateChannelMembershipRequest)
member.summary:
Adds a user to a channel. The InvitedBy response field is derived from the request header. A channel member can:
List messages
Send messages
Receive messages
Edit their own messages
Leave the channel
Privacy settings impact this action as follows:
Public Channels: You do not need to be a member to list messages, but you must be a member to send messages.
Private Channels: You must be a member to list or send messages.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateChannelMembership service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateChannelMembership service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.

Deletes a channel flow, an irreversible process. This is a developer API.
This API works only when the channel flow is not associated with any channel. To get a list of all channels that a channel flow is associated with, use the ListChannelsAssociatedWithChannelFlow API. Use the DisassociateChannelFlow API to disassociate a channel flow from all channels.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteChannelFlow service method.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteChannelFlow service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.

member.summary:
Disassociates a channel flow from all its channels. Once disassociated, all messages to that channel stop going through the channel flow processor.

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.IAmazonChimeSDKMessaging.GetChannelMessageStatus(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.GetChannelMessageStatusRequest)
member.summary:
Gets message status for a specified messageId. Use this API to determine the intermediate status of messages going through channel flow processing. The API provides an alternative to retrieving message status if the event was not received because a client wasn't connected to a websocket.
Messages can have any one of these statuses.
SENT
Message processed successfully
PENDING
Ongoing processing
FAILED
Processing failed
DENIED
Messasge denied by the processor
This API does not return statuses for denied messages, because we don't store them once the processor denies them.
Only the message sender can invoke this API.
The x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetChannelMessageStatus service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetChannelMessageStatus service method, as returned by ChimeSDKMessaging.
member.exception: The input parameters don't match the service's restrictions.
The client is permanently forbidden from making the request.
The service encountered an unexpected error.
The service is currently unavailable.
The client exceeded its request rate limit.
The client is not currently authorized to make the request.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetChannelMessageStatus Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.IAmazonChimeSDKMessaging.ListChannelMessages(Amazon.ChimeSDKMessaging.Model.ListChannelMessagesRequest)
member.summary:
List all the messages in a channel. Returns a paginated list of ChannelMessages. By default, sorted by creation timestamp in descending order.
Redacted messages appear in the results as empty, since they are only redacted, not deleted. Deleted messages do not appear in the results. This action always returns the latest version of an edited message.
Also, the x-amz-chime-bearer request header is mandatory. Use the AppInstanceUserArn of the user that makes the API call as the value in the header.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListChannelMessages service method.
